website_summaries.verdict: A beautiful set of stamps at an attractive price point. Even the storage box is pleasing to the eye.
pros: Stamps come in a beautiful, well organised wooden box
Stamps are short enough to make a strong imprint, but still long enough to be held comfortably
Letters and numbers are bold and leave a deep imprint that is easy to read
Stamps are available in 4mm and 8mm sizes
cons: Depending on the level of pressure applied: round outline of stamp can sometimes be seen

customer_reviews.title: almost great, very good
customer_reviews.text: Great stamps for small print and numbers. I am using them to stamp veg-tan leather. The included box is nice. The stamps are clean (no oil residue to contend with), the leave a clear impression that is easy to read with only one exception. The letter W does not work well and just looks like a blur. I gave 4 stars instead of 5 due to the one poor quality letter stamp and because there is no mark on the handle marking which way is up. Otherwise a great set at a good price that I am glad I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: B. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Keys are hard to stamp, wood is Ok
customer_reviews.text: Item looks professional - from the beautiful finger jointed box to the labeling on the inside for each single punch stamp. Stamps themselves are so so. Took me a few tries to figure out applicable force for punching into keys and yet, even after holding the stamp perfectly perpendicular to the key, some indentations come out only halfway. Wood stamps OK, but keys not so much.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing quality for the price. I was a little skeptical at first but after reading reviews and remembering how great our other Amazon Basics products are, I purchased it. I'm new to metal stamping but these work great and I won't need to upgrade for a long time. I recommend these to anyone new to the craft or anyone looking to replace their current set.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Brownlow

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, solid
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set and chose the Amazon Prime option that explained: "Like New: Item will come in original packaging. Packaging will be damaged." The only thing damaged was the outer box, which was apparently not its original package. The permanent box the stamps come in is made of very lightweight wood. The stamps themselves are easy to handle and are of sturdy, solid metal. As with many stamps, care must be made to hold a stamp straight as it is tapped so that the letter - and not the stamp handle area - will impress the material you are working with.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: good entry level set
customer_reviews.text: This tool set give the user a good entry level set to start their projects with. The alignment of the letters & numbers on their handle is somewhat off and it is difficult to get a straight line of numbers or letters. Using a straight edge to keep things in alignment is always helpful but a necessity for this set. I have used this set to mark hardwood and brass.
customer_reviews.author: swimguy

customer_reviews.title: Ok for steel, better for copper, brass.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice large stamps, that being said I don’t think the primary use should be steel. These probably work really well on soft metals like brass or copper. For mild steel the letters and numbers aren’t aggressive enough (the letters and numbers are a bit shallow) to leave good deep impressions in the material. They do work but you really have to hit hard to leave a good stamp, with that said I’m not sure they will hold up to long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Roger T.

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to stamp without imprinting a circle around your letter.
customer_reviews.text: Product comes in a nice case for storage, but it’s almost impossible to stamp without imprinting the circle at the base of the letter. The handle is square, but at the tip it becomes circular, and the letter is on the circle. You have to tap VERY lightly to not also stamp the circle with the letter. I wish the letters were a little deeper so you could stand without the circle digging into the leather, and they didn’t make it circular where the letter is. This small change would make them great letter stamps.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly adequate
customer_reviews.text: I have used these a couple times for stamping aluminum tubes. They work, no signs of wear. My main critique is they are a bit shallow so hard to get an even stamp on a tube, and it does not give a deep impression. Pros: They work No issues Just is: 0 and O is the same Cons: Letters are too shallow for my preference. Makes it hard to work on a curved surface and less prominent Bit small On metal, you get 1 shot; if you double tap it just leaves 2 different hard to read marks. So practice the strike power before using it on the finished product.
customer_reviews.author: DHO

customer_reviews.title: This font is UGLY.
customer_reviews.text: These work just fine. However, the font is not what you see on the box. It's very tall and thin, so that the letters are much taller than they are wide. It's really, truly ugly. There are plenty of other stamp kits on Amazon that have a nice looking font. Buy one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I used it for the first time in my leather tag for my bag, and it’s a little hard to make a beautiful job, but it works well.
customer_reviews.author: emybege

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete set
customer_reviews.text: Did not have a complete A-Z set of characters. Returned it for a refund. Did not stamp SS tags well anyway. Maybe aluminum or copper.
customer_reviews.author: Tom. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I ordered them to be used for a craft project for a group of women who came to our Sisters on the Fly event last fall. We used them with metal blanks to label our Dutch ovens - one for the pot and one on the lid. The gals had a great time hammering their names, Sister numbers, whatever onto the tags. No more confusing who's Dutch oven is whos. And I loved that they were a little bigger than the other sets I saw.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn Stearns

customer_reviews.title: No groove to let you know the orientation of letter.
customer_reviews.text: Other sets I have purchased had a grove along the face to indicate you were holding the punch so the letters/numbers were facing the same way. I did not know how much time it saved till I bought these - you have to double check each time you select a punch.
customer_reviews.author: Ray S

customer_reviews.title: Seem strong and well made
customer_reviews.text: Seem very well made. Strong material. Hoping I got large enough ones for a couple of the jobs I needed them for. The seem a little small though they are the exact size that was listed for them, I just didnt quite realize how small that was. Either way that's on me for 1 and 2 I still really like them and love the case they came in, both gorgeous and well made. Sturdy as well. Over all great set that I hope to be using for years to cone.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Tony T

customer_reviews.title: Horrible if wanting to use for Metal Stamping
customer_reviews.text: Works fine on leather, but cannot get ANY consistent stampings on metals. Recommended ONLY for SOFT METALS or the like. Soft meaning softer than whatever keys are made of
customer_reviews.author: Social Interactions

customer_reviews.title: Too large yet not sharp enough to engrave tools/hard metal
customer_reviews.text: The letters are pretty big. if they were considerably smaller they'd be more useful for stamping tools and other materials with my information. They also aren't really hard enough to leave a good indentation, even when I hit them pretty hard (I'm a big guy). Overall not my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Christian L

customer_reviews.title: Good stamps, absolute garbage container
customer_reviews.text: Received the package and promptly opened the stamps. As I opened the box, the entire bottom fell out, all the stamps crashed to the floor and dented my wood floors. The bottom of the box is made out of paper thin wood which would never hold the weight of the stamps. I now have a pile of stamps and no container to put them in.
customer_reviews.author: C. Cleland

customer_reviews.title: Leave a good impression in the leather.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. They leave a good imprint without a lot of difficulty. I used them to stamp leather tags to add to my crochet winter hats. They really look great! There’s a video on my YouTube channel if you’re interested. It’s called DIY leather labels at Creating a Simpler life.
customer_reviews.author: Creating A Simpler Life

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but poor design
customer_reviews.text: They look fine and are heavy duty but when you use them, the letter is not raised enough from the tool. Because of this, it imprints the circle of the tool itself around the letter. Basically it makes all the letters look like they are surrounded by a small circle
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Handy little letters!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on leather! I got leather bound notebooks for my team for Christmas and thought they might enjoy stamping in their own initials. Some of them decided to write inspirational quotes! You should have seen all the other teams walking by eyeing them up and telling us how cool they were!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Mitten

customer_reviews.title: Tiny
customer_reviews.text: Too small , don’t buy if you using it for clay project s ,’it’s so tiny! Not returning it . It’s cost half the cost to return it .
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Wahl

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth the money, too soft.
customer_reviews.text: The stamps are not very hard, so the shoulders of the letters are made fat, and the points are made blunt so they wont peen over when struck. This causes you to have to strike them hard enough to make them bounce a bit and make double imprints.
customer_reviews.author: Mike In NJ

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but check your letters!
customer_reviews.text: Nice set for my uses, mostly for personal labeling, but also work. Sturdy. Only issue on my end was receiving two "V" stamps and no "A". I made sure to double check, and compared my stamps to the photos here showing the "A", and I do in fact have two "V"s. Not too mad though, it can just seem like a stylistic choice in all honesty!
customer_reviews.author: Marji

customer_reviews.title: I'll be returning
customer_reviews.text: Imprint is not deep enough so it you will get a ring around your letter. Also they were so dirty, they turned my fingers black and got black on my project. I put them back in the box to return them about 5 seconds into my project.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Murray

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly, Best Price
customer_reviews.text: These work so well for stamping the bottom of my pottery with my initials and the year. I considered other brands but all were at least $10 more and the numbers and letters were sold separately. The box makes the product much larger than the kind that are packed into a case touching each other, but I personally like the box a lot. I covered the Amazon Basics logo with a name tag so I can identify it at the studio and it looks high quality and professional.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Skip
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Prek students to make charm necklaces and it didn’t work like I thought it would. Was hard for me to stamp and the kids were unable to do it
customer_reviews.author: soccerlovinmom

customer_reviews.title: I should have taken a picture.
customer_reviews.text: They are really nice, however, I didn’t do my due diligence to determine how big they were. I needed the smaller ones as well as lowercase. The wooden box is sturdy and the stamps fit perfectly. Once I become more comfortable in stamping I may order these again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good for leather
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to make leather tags. They suck hammering into leather, looks nothing like their example photo. IDK if it's because the letters are so thin or what but I wouldn't recommend these. Will be returning
customer_reviews.author: Timbre Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great for stamping brass, copper and even hot steel!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for a while now and they are holding up just fine. I use them for stamping all kinds of things including hot steel when forging.
customer_reviews.author: car99r

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality...needed to be hardened better!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to stamp copper...but they wear very fast. I was not impressed with the overall quality, as they should hold up longer than what I used them for.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gallier

customer_reviews.title: Work well on Aluminum
customer_reviews.text: These worked well for stamping hull number on an aluminum hull. Not sure how well they would work on steel since a serious blow was required for relatively soft Al.
customer_reviews.author: C.A. O.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this set of number and letter markers.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and read. The large shank is perfect for not smashing your fingers when hitting them or striking them with a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Stendel

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy and solid.
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy I haven't used them yet but will update when I do.
customer_reviews.author: Lost Traditions

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love them use them all the time to mark items no worries about someone wipe off something u lable with a marker no more worries .
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and works as expected. The case is handy for keeping the letters and numbers easily organized and accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Overland

customer_reviews.title: These work great!
customer_reviews.text: I got great imprints in hardened steel. The box they came in isnt as flimsy as some reviews made it out to be. You can easily line the punches up on your project by making pencil or chalk lines that can be removed. There are several ways to perform the punches properly. If they dont come out lined up or fully punched its pretty much all your fault. Dont blame the tools.
customer_reviews.author: Spicoli

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Loaded
customer_reviews.text: What a speedy order.. Heavy package too!! Exactly what I ordered and of good quality.Now I'm going to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Janice M. McCue

customer_reviews.title: Leaves a nice deep impression in leather.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the alphabet set. Used it for arts and crafts leather projects at our church camp for pre-teens. They were able to use them with ease and got great results. It only takes two to three hits of the hammer to get a nice deep impression. Plan to purchase a second set so the campers won't have to wait as long for the letter they need next!
customer_reviews.author: Betty J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: nice set.
customer_reviews.text: Nice basic set. Nothing special. I like the wood storage box. wish it had a few other design patterns and at least a punch or dot.
customer_reviews.author: chris yackel

customer_reviews.title: No corresponding # or letter on side of stamp
customer_reviews.text: Easy to stamp upside down if you do not pay attention.. No # or Letter on side of stamp..
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jernigan

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good product. The only thing is that the latch from the box is kind of fragile so you have to be easy with it.
customer_reviews.author: ivan

customer_reviews.title: Nice box
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used yet but will bought new trailer need to stamp my brand in the steel frame.
customer_reviews.author: kermit bengtson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These are just as described. They make a perfect indent in the metal I bought to use them with. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Thank you. These are really small but , works well with what I needed them for. Just letting everyone know they are very small. Not sellers fault mine did not calculate the size right.
customer_reviews.author: Melynda Onusaitis

customer_reviews.title: Very nice basic set
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to mark my plant tags for my garden and they have worked very well for that purpose
customer_reviews.author: Rae Koziczkowski

customer_reviews.title: Inspect carefully
customer_reviews.text: Came without stamp for 6/9, not critical for my current need but this should not happen
customer_reviews.author: RMJ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy reusable container which kept the stamps in order
customer_reviews.text: Little bit larger than previous stamps bought, but work well and very usable.
customer_reviews.author: GARY FONDA

customer_reviews.title: Illegible
customer_reviews.text: I sent them back, the letters were Illegible on leather and metal.
customer_reviews.author: Ben eva

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but came rusted.
customer_reviews.text: Nice punches for the money and come in a really nice box, but they came rusted.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: sturdy, well made stamp set. Price is much better than other brands. Fully satisfied and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R Hutter

customer_reviews.title: Good set of stamps for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Like all metal stamps these need to be hit very hard the first time and it will work well.
customer_reviews.author: nellie

customer_reviews.title: Clear stamping
customer_reviews.text: Only used two stamps for my initials and very happy with the results
customer_reviews.author: H. E.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: These are nice to imprint your tools of make dog tags
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stratman

customer_reviews.title: I look forward to making personalized jewelry.
customer_reviews.text: I hope that these work as well as I expect, but haven't had the chance to try them yet. They seem to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: GabbaD

customer_reviews.title: Good workmanship
customer_reviews.text: I plan to use them often, and they were as described. I plan to buy the 5/16-inch size, too. These are great for personalizing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: ARobinson

customer_reviews.title: Watch someone on YouTube demonstrate how to youse this properly.
customer_reviews.text: Not really going to ‘ding the product here’. My difficulties in using the set I am guessing is mostly operator error. Definitely look up on YouTube how to do this. The set is nice. Very well presented. The letters are bigger than you would think. If you are putting on brass tags, there is not a ton of room.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: works as expected
customer_reviews.text: make sure you use a mallet when stamping for an even stamp
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got it I was so excited and finally put it to use. Great product I highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Vega Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Organized Stamp Set-Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what my hubby was looking for. He plans to use it for stamping leather headbands inside cowboy hats. He appreciates having the stamps organized in the case.
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Shopper in TX

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice box to store the metal stamps. Well made!
customer_reviews.author: Amber C. Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: These just don’t work that well. You have to hit them so hard to get the letter to show up that you get the hole circle of the bit imprinted as well.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Great punch set!
customer_reviews.text: I love it’s wooden case. Very easy to use. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: DAY-VER

customer_reviews.title: Not Good For Leather
customer_reviews.text: The letter is too thin to stamp on leather. It's better for metal or wood.
customer_reviews.author: jhsny

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great to stamp my name into about 10 brass tags to affix to my travel tool box.
customer_reviews.author: MSS

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Well pleased withe leather stamp set. The wooden box, that holds the stamps, is a plus, too.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Letters are very tiny
customer_reviews.text: I used it to emboss a wood project with my name.
customer_reviews.author: ruby

customer_reviews.title: Well made, well packaged
customer_reviews.text: Came very well packaged. The stamps themselves are stored in a sturdy box. The stamps are very clear and well made. Overall a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Yas KWEEN!
customer_reviews.text: Freaking fantastic value for this set of letters and numbers! So sturdy and heavy duty!
customer_reviews.author: Easy-E

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I try to use it but no good results. I have no clue how to make it work
customer_reviews.author: Freckles

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: The stamps are nice seem to be holding up well. Like the case they came in easy to find the stamps and put away .
customer_reviews.author: J Fitz

customer_reviews.title: Nice stamp set
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. Produces a crisp, clear image on leather and soft metals. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: J. Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for jewelry stamping. My girls are please with it
customer_reviews.author: amanda cramer

customer_reviews.title: they're number stamps...
customer_reviews.text: These work great. nice wooden box to store them. they are holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Plisky

customer_reviews.title: Stamps are sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Stamps are made of good metal, I have made several stamps into good steel. I recommend you use a good sized hammer and get a good strike on the first hit.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Unattractive font
customer_reviews.text: Font is very narrow, not attractive. I returned this item.
customer_reviews.author: long runner

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if stamping leather (belt)
customer_reviews.text: Letters much smaller than expected and hardly makes a mark on leather. I tried to pound it harder to make a better imprint but then there were circles left around each letter.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Decent value
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the stamps are not marked on the top or side to know which way to face the letter without looking at the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: It’s good but not great!
customer_reviews.text: It’s good if you don’t want your stamps to show much... I was expecting a deep stamp but it’s very small and even hard to stain the stamp is so shallow.
customer_reviews.author: kyle Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Complete set, good value
customer_reviews.text: Just like the headline says, it's a good value, plus the price is great.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Janke

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Did the job I bought them for. Great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use was just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.author: Anthony carrizosa

customer_reviews.title: Great use
customer_reviews.text: My husband likes it and easy to use to put his name on his products when making welding remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Sumbila Simic

customer_reviews.title: Solid material but didn’t like how it imprints in clay
customer_reviews.text: Came in the Woden box as it shown on the website. Solid metal stamps but I didn’t like all the letter imprints with circle shapes. I am returning mine.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren J. Yoon

customer_reviews.title: sturdy but if put in vaseline right away they will get full of rust within a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: when the stamps arrived, i checked them and they had rust spots in almost every single one, thankfully none of the rust was in any of the stamping face.
customer_reviews.author: Kendrick Ayala Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great set of stamps, the case keeps them neat and in order.
customer_reviews.author: tatyana kaftan

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: Good product for what I needed it for. Very heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Metal Alphabet And Number Stamp Kit Tools Set With Wood Box - 5/32 Inch
feature_bullets: Stamp kit for creating permanent hand-stamped imprints; 5/32-inch character height
Includes upper-case A-Z letters, 0-9 numbers, and “&” symbol for exceptional versatility
Works with metal, leather, wood, clay, and more; great for a variety of applications
Made from durable alloy steel with a sand-blasted finish for strength and clear imprints, even over time
Wooden storage box included; backed by an AmazonBasics limited 1-year warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars654 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
